thread.title: Twisted and tortured: Carwoola fire aftermath in photos
thread.title_full: Twisted and tortured: Carwoola fire aftermath in photos

author: Alkira Reinfrank
title: Twisted and tortured: Carwoola fire aftermath in photos
text:
The waiting game 
It was an anxious 24 hours for many residents in the Carwoola area. 
On Friday afternoon they were evacuated as a fast moving and out-of-control grassfire swept through the rural community. 
The blaze burnt through 3,500 hectares and destroyed or damaged 14 houses. 
On Saturday many were allowed to return to their homes, or what was left of them. Photo: Odette Neumann was anxious to get home to assess the damage. (ABC News: Alkira Reinfrank) 
"We don't know when we can get in, they can't tell us. Hopefully a couple of hours and we can get in," resident Odette Neumann said. Behind the line 
When they returned, they saw rugged bushland became scorched earth and charred trees. 
The only contrast â€” the bright emergency tape tied to blackened gates marking the fate of the homes.
